“Gag” on doctors discussing assisted dying with patients should be changed, Ministry of Health says https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/gag-on-doctors-discussing-auxiliary-dying-with-病人-should-be-changed-ministry-of-health-says/W72HJNKF45AJJGETPWYJ4DLDZ4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/gag-on-doctors-discussing-auxiliary-dying-with-病人-should-be-changed-ministry-of-health-says/W72HJNKF45AJJGETPWYJ4DLDZ4/ Isaac DavisonGovernment says any changes will be left to a member's bill. Tue, 26 Nov 2024 16:00:00 +0000 The Ministry of Health review found the assisted dying law was generally working well, but that some areas needed improving. So far, 978 people have had an assisted death in New Zealand.
